response: the protection of personal information is crucial for data privacy and security. the european union has implemented the general data protection regulation (gdpr), which provides strict guidelines and rules to protect individuals' data privacy rights. these include the right to access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, and data portability. individuals have control over their personal information and can request companies to delete it at any time. this regulation aims to safeguard citizens from data breaches, identity theft, and other cybercrimes. companies must ensure that they adhere to these regulations to avoid legal action and financial penalties.
